Description: Green rectangular bead, pierced longitudinally serrated edges, incised crossed lines on both sides.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar bead found in Memphis (Nicholson 2013, 280-282, Fig.II.30, F-435). Nicholson, P. T. (ed.) 2013. Working in Memphis: The production of faience at Roman period Kom Helul. London: Egypt Exploration Society.
Xia type PN16/65. Xia, N. 2014, Ancient Egyptian Beads, Heidelberg.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QG.01)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5266 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
